body_html:
It sounds like you just want this fixed.

On my end, I really do not want to convert this tuple into a struct if there are alternatives. I would much rather look into structural fixes, so we don't have to waste time on this problem in the future.

I'm hopeful that it may be possible to fix xla::StatusOr so it doesn't have this problem. If you can't come up with a fix there, I will consult with the C++ experts on my end, but it may take some time. (It's possible that xla::StatusOr will Just Work. In any case I'm going to get rid of SE's StatusOr as my first task here.)

body:
It sounds like you just want this fixed.

On my end, I really do not want to convert this tuple into a struct if there are alternatives.  I would much rather look into structural fixes, so we don't have to waste time on this problem in the future.

I'm hopeful that it may be possible to fix xla::StatusOr so it doesn't have this problem.  If you can't come up with a fix there, I will consult with the C++ experts on my end, but it may take some time.  (It's possible that xla::StatusOr will Just Work.  In any case I'm going to get rid of SE's StatusOr as my first task here.)
